result.execSummary:
The defendant Derick Travis Mortenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court cost.
Defendant is to pay restitution in the amount of $1259.99 plus 10% surcharge in the amount of $126.00. Restitution is to be joint and several with Trempealeau County case # 22CF11.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.
Defendant to complete AODA Assessment and all follow through.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derick Travis Mortenson in court, in custody.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski appeared by video for Derick Travis Mortenson. Defense filed motion to modify bond, argument made. State has no objection to reduction of bond but not to the amount defense is requesting. Defense advised request remains the same. Court amends bond. Defense requests to set for PLEAS. PLEAS set.

Defense advised state open to counter offer, needs more time come to resolution. Defense requests for bond hearing, motion to be filed. BBH set. Bond cont.
